summary:
# Developers Guide for ID Verification APIs in Banking Apps

Emily Daniel

·

Follow

Published in

CodeX

·

5 min read

·

Sep 11, 2021

\--

Listen

Share

Among all other sectors, banks have to deal with the most sensitive data i.e.
financial information. These institutions obtain the financial details of
customers that must be safeguarded against internal or external threats.
Security breaches in the banking industry can disrupt the whole corporate
system. In recent years, KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money
Laundering) practices have shifted to regulations from restrictions to
guarantee security. According to a report, a conventional bank can **_save up
to 10 million Euros_** by using extended technologies for AML/KYC compliance.

# Remote Identity Verification — A High-Tech Protection for Banks

In today’s era of technological advancements, identity verification can be
done without an in-person meeting — through online platforms. Online identity
verification has proved to be an effective and feasible method for mitigating
identity fraud, financial scams, and potential money laundering. Using AI
models IDV can now be performed through automated solutions instead of humans,
the software has negligible errors authorizing only legitimate users to access
the banking accounts.

Identity verification solutions can be used in both phases, verification and
authentication. Let’s discuss the first one, the customer’s identity is
verified by validating their government-approved ID documents (like a
passport) and the photo ID is matched against facial biometrics. In the
second, the live captured selfie is compared with the previously stored
biometrics during verification. The IDV solution can be integrated into
banking apps and websites through APIs.

# What to consider while choosing a Third Party API!

Software developers have to integrate extended AI-driven technologies while
developing a banking app or website. They have to put in extra effort while
developing modules for **_Facial Recognition_** _, Document Verification and
Data Extraction._

 _So why develop an in-house solution when you can easily outsource the entire
process._

Software engineers should consider the following things before purchasing
APIs.

## Defining End-Users

The individuals that are directly using software or a product are called end-
users. The developers and businesses always identify and define their end-
users to provide them services accordingly. There are different factors of
classifying end-users like demography and age group of their clientele, and
also not to mention their socio-economic situation and why they are using the
software.

API solutions should reflect the requirements of end-users with no extra
functionality. It should be user-friendly and requires no additional training.
As banks have vast customers hailing from all sections of society from a
layman to a college professor, the functionality of API must be universal.

Make sure you describe your end-user clearly to the API provider…

Once you have defined your end-user, make sure the API UX and UI is in line
with the demands of your end-user. API interface should be easy to use for the
end-user…

## User Experience & Interface

The way a user interacts with or uses a software product is known as user
experience and the visual designs, layouts and typography is referred to as
the user interface. As the users can be from different backgrounds and regions
so the colours, interface and language should suit them.

The verification flow should be easy to understand for the end-user. It should
be self-explanatory as the whole idea of digital IDV is seamless and smooth
identity verification.

## Data Protection

As discussed earlier, data is the most significant element in banking. The ID
pictures are to be shared with the API provider for verification. If the data
is used for any other purpose like selling to marketing firms, it can lead to
legal suits of data privacy.

The data should be encrypted and stored in the cloud servers (so that it can
be accessed globally) adhering to international data protection standards like
_GDPR_. Furthermore, the end-user must have the authority for the
removal/deletion of data after a specific time frame.

## Portability

The independence of the operating system (OS) and version tells how long a
software can be used in future. If the software can’t upgrade to corresponding
versions of the OS, there are infrequent chances that it will sustain itself
in the long run. The software should be operational on all major operating
systems (Android, iOS and Windows) so that it could have a wider range of
users. The portability of API must be studied before choosing as it can
restrict the number of users.

The API should pass these portability tests;

 **Installability:** Checking the installation on various systems,
environments and versions with valid hardware configuration. The allocation of
libraries and dependent files is also tested.

 **Compatibility:** It is the characteristic of a module (software) to operate
successfully with other modules.

 **Adaptability:** The capability of software to adapt to changing
environments or components without any additional actions.

## Market Value

It is the best strategy for picking a product, for example, a user will see
the rating of an app before downloading one. The same can be done for
selecting APIs for a banking app. The market value can be analysed by studying
the provider’s clients reviews. The Salesforce Appexchange is one of the most
trustable sources while studying the market value or client satisfaction of
identity management (IDM) software like IDV solutions.

# Why Third-Party APIs? -

It can be thought that if software engineers can develop a whole banking app,
they can also develop an identity verification module.

 _Have a look at the benefits of Third-Party APIs before developing an IDV
solution._

## \- Quicker Development

It saves the time of the development team as they do have to work on totally
different functions and modules. The span of months can be reduced to days by
integrating previously developed APIs. This time can be utilized for other
significant tasks during the SDLC.

## \- Cost Reduction

Budget affects software development the most after time. Developing an in-
house solution can take months, thus more salaries have to be paid to
developers. Through API integration, the budget can be reduced and could
invest in improving the features and removing bugs from the app.

## \- Skilful Development

The development team isn’t proficient in all aspects of software engineering.
Using third party APIs can give the best features — as are developed by
skilful field developers, also eliminating unnecessary hurdles while
development.

## \- Increased Scalability

The in-house software can’t have the level of scalability that modern IDV
solutions are providing. As the solutions have been tested and upgraded
continuously for improvements, the new software will take much time to achieve
that level.

The IDV software is trained on thousands of datasets to spot abnormalities in
the ID documents and detect fraudulent attempts. The new software will not be
mature enough to perform verification with the same efficiency.

# Final Thoughts

Developing a banking mobile app or website requires drivers skills which can
increase time and cost, however, previously developed APIs can be purchased
from third parties. The identity verification API and SDK can be utilized for
complying with KYC/AML regulations without putting extra effort into
development.

priceAndPlans:
# A Comprehensive Guide to Price Comparison APIs: Unlock the Power of
Competitive Pricing with CronJ

liva jorge

·

Follow

6 min read

·

Apr 3

\--

Listen

Share

Introduction:

In today’s rapidly evolving e-commerce landscape, price comparison has become
an essential tool for online retailers and consumers alike. With thousands of
products available at the click of a button, it’s crucial for businesses to
stay competitive and offer the best prices to their customers. This is where
price comparison APIs come into play. In this blog, we’ll explore the world of
price comparison APIs, their benefits, and how you can leverage them to stay
ahead of the competition. We’ll also discuss how CronJ, as an expert in API
development, can help you create a seamless and efficient price comparison
solution for your business.

 **Price Comparison APIs: An Overview**

Price comparison APIs are Application Programming Interfaces that provide
developers and businesses access to real-time pricing data from various online
retailers and e-commerce platforms. They help businesses compare product
prices, offers, discounts, and other relevant information to make informed
decisions and optimize pricing strategies. By integrating these APIs into
their applications, businesses can offer their customers the best deals and
enhance their user experience.

 **How Price Comparison APIs Work:**

Price comparison APIs work by aggregating data from multiple sources, such as
online retailers and e-commerce websites. When a user makes a request to the
API, it sends the query to the relevant data sources and retrieves the
requested pricing information. The API then processes and organizes the data,
returning it to the user in a structured format, such as JSON or XML. This
information can be used to display real-time pricing comparisons, allowing
users to make better-informed decisions when shopping online.

 **The Role of Web Scraping in Price Comparison APIs:**

Web scraping is a technique used to extract data from websites and web pages
by parsing the HTML source code. It plays a crucial role in the functioning of
price comparison APIs. Web scraping tools and libraries are used to collect
pricing data from various e-commerce platforms and online retailers. This data
is then cleaned, structured, and stored in databases or data warehouses.

Price comparison APIs rely on web scraping to gather the most up-to-date and
accurate pricing information. However, web scraping can be challenging due to
the varying structures of websites, the dynamic nature of web content, and
potential legal and ethical concerns. To ensure compliance with web scraping
regulations, price comparison API developers must carefully consider the data
they collect and the methods they use to obtain it.

 **The Benefits of Price Comparison APIs**

  1. Real-time Price Tracking: One of the most significant advantages of price comparison APIs is the ability to access real-time pricing data from multiple online retailers and e-commerce platforms. This enables businesses and developers to stay up-to-date with the latest price changes, promotions, and discounts. By having access to real-time information, businesses can make quick and informed decisions about their pricing strategies and react promptly to market changes.
  2. Enhancing Customer Experience: Integrating price comparison APIs into applications, websites, or e-commerce platforms can significantly improve the customer experience. By offering users the convenience of comparing prices from various sources in one place, businesses can help their customers find the best deals and make informed purchasing decisions. This enhanced user experience can lead to increased customer satisfaction, loyalty, and repeat business.
  3. Competitive Pricing Strategy: Price comparison APIs can help businesses develop and maintain a competitive pricing strategy. By providing insights into the pricing strategies of competitors, businesses can analyze market trends and adjust their pricing accordingly. This can lead to increased sales, higher revenue, and a competitive edge in the market.
  4. Inventory Management: Price comparison APIs can play a crucial role in inventory management by providing businesses with insights into market demand, popular products, and price trends. By monitoring the pricing data of similar products across different platforms, businesses can make informed decisions about their inventory levels, pricing, and product assortment. This can help optimize inventory management processes, reduce stockouts and overstocks, and improve overall operational efficiency.

 **Popular Price Comparison APIs in the Market**

  1. Amazon Product Advertising API: The Amazon Product Advertising API provides programmatic access to Amazon’s massive product catalog and enables developers to advertise Amazon products on their websites and applications. This API offers features such as product search, product details, customer reviews, and product recommendations, which can be used to create a comprehensive price comparison solution for users.
  2. Google Shopping API: Google Shopping API, formerly known as Google Shopping Content API, allows developers to manage their product listings on Google Shopping. It offers features such as product search, product details, and price information from multiple retailers. This API enables developers to integrate Google Shopping data into their applications, offering users the ability to compare prices across different platforms and find the best deals.
  3. eBay API: The eBay API offers a suite of services that allow developers to access eBay’s massive marketplace and integrate it into their applications. With features such as product search, product details, and pricing information, developers can create price comparison solutions that help users find the best deals on eBay. The eBay API also offers additional features like bidding, listing, and order management for a more comprehensive integration.
  4. Walmart API: The Walmart API enables developers to access product data from Walmart, one of the largest retail chains in the world. This API offers features such as product search, product details, price information, and store availability. By integrating the Walmart API into their applications, developers can offer users the ability to compare prices and find the best deals from Walmart’s extensive product catalog.

 **Key Features to Look for in a Price Comparison API**

  1. Data accuracy: When selecting a price comparison API, it’s crucial to ensure that the API provides accurate and up-to-date pricing information. This helps users make informed decisions and builds trust in your price comparison tool.
  2. API call limits and rate limiting: Different APIs have different limits on the number of calls you can make within a specific time frame. It’s essential to consider these limitations when selecting a price comparison API, as they can impact the performance of your application, especially during peak usage times.
  3. Ease of integration: Choose a price comparison API that is easy to integrate with your existing system or application. APIs with clear documentation, sample code, and SDKs can simplify the integration process and save you time and effort.
  4. Comprehensive documentation and support: Good documentation and support are essential for a smooth integration process. Look for APIs that offer comprehensive documentation, FAQs, and responsive support channels to help you address any issues that may arise during the integration process.

 **Custom Price Comparison API Development with CronJ**

  1. Custom API development tailored to your business needs: CronJ can help you develop custom price comparison APIs tailored to your specific business requirements. This ensures that your API provides the data and functionality necessary for your unique use case.
  2. Integrating price comparison APIs into your existing system: CronJ’s team of experts can seamlessly integrate price comparison APIs into your existing system, ensuring a smooth user experience and minimal disruptions to your operations.
  3. Security and scalability: CronJ prioritizes security and scalability in custom API development. By following industry best practices and using cutting-edge technologies, CronJ ensures that your price comparison API is secure and can handle increased traffic and data volume as your business grows.
  4. Ongoing maintenance and support: CronJ offers ongoing maintenance and support for your custom price comparison API, ensuring that it continues to perform optimally and remains up-to-date with the latest industry standards and trends. This includes regular updates, bug fixes, and performance improvements to keep your API functioning at its best.

Conclusion:

Price comparison APIs are a powerful tool for businesses looking to stay
competitive in today’s fast-paced e-commerce environment. By providing real-
time pricing data, they can help you make informed decisions about your
pricing strategy, inventory management, and customer experience. As an expert
in API development, CronJ can help you create a custom price comparison
solution that meets your unique business needs. With our extensive experience
in web scraping and API integration, we can help you harness the power of
competitive pricing and drive success for your business.
